content:
IdentityConfiguration Class

Definition

Defines the collection of configurable properties controlling the behavior of the Windows Identity Foundation.

In this Article

public class IdentityConfiguration
Inheritance
System.Object
IdentityConfiguration

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Constructors

IdentityConfiguration()

Initializes a new instance of the IdentityConfiguration class. Settings are loaded from the default configuration, if it exists.

public IdentityConfiguration ();

Remarks

Property values are loaded from the unnamed <identityConfiguration> element in the configuration file, if such an element exists; otherwise, properties are set to their default values.

IdentityConfiguration(Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the IdentityConfiguration class by using a value that specifies whether settings should be loaded from the default configuration.

public IdentityConfiguration (bool loadConfig);
loadConfig
Boolean

true to load settings from the configuration file; otherwise false.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

loadConfig is true, but there is no <system.identityModel> configuration element.

Remarks

If loadConfig is true, property values are loaded from the unnamed <identityConfiguration> element in the configuration file; otherwise properties are set to their default values.

IdentityConfiguration(X509Certificate2)

Initializes a new instance of the IdentityConfiguration class that has the specified service certificate.

public IdentityConfiguration (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 serviceCertificate);
serviceCertificate
X509Certificate2

The service certificate. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.ServiceCertificate* property.

Remarks

Property values are loaded from the unnamed <identityConfiguration> element in the configuration file, if such an element exists; otherwise, properties are set to their default values.

IdentityConfiguration(String)

Initializes a new instance of the IdentityConfiguration class. Settings are loaded from the named configuration.

public IdentityConfiguration (string identityConfigurationName);
identityConfigurationName
String

The name of the <identityConfiguration> element from which settings are to be loaded.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

There is no <system.identityModel> configuration element.

Remarks

If this constructor is called then a System.IdentityModel configuration section with the provided name must exist in the configuration file.

IdentityConfiguration(Boolean,X509Certificate2)

Initializes a new instance of the IdentityConfiguration class that has the specified service certificate. Settings are optionally loading the default configuration.

public IdentityConfiguration (bool loadConfig, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 serviceCertificate);
loadConfig
Boolean

true to load settings from the configuration file; otherwise false.

serviceCertificate
X509Certificate2

The service certificate. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.ServiceCertificate* property.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

loadConfig is true, but there is no <system.identityModel> configuration element.

Remarks

If loadConfig is true, property values are loaded from the unnamed <identityConfiguration> element in the configuration file; otherwise properties are set to their default values.

IdentityConfiguration(String,X509Certificate2)

Initializes a new instance of the IdentityConfiguration class that has the specified service certificate, loading the named configuration.

public IdentityConfiguration (string identityConfigurationName, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 serviceCertificate);
identityConfigurationName
String

The name of the <service> element from which configuration is to be loaded

serviceCertificate
X509Certificate2

The service certificate. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.ServiceCertificate* property.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

There is no <System.IdentityModel> configuration element

Fields

DefaultCertificateValidationMode

The default X.509 certificate validation mode, X509CertificateValidationMode.

public static readonly System.ServiceModel.Security.X509CertificateValidationMode DefaultCertificateValidationMode;

DefaultIssuerNameRegistryType

The default issuer name registry type; the Type of the ConfigurationBasedIssuerNameRegistry class.

public static readonly Type DefaultIssuerNameRegistryType;

DefaultMaxClockSkew

The default maximum clock skew; 5 minutes.

public static readonly TimeSpan DefaultMaxClockSkew;

DefaultRevocationMode

The default X.509 revocation mode; X509RevocationMode.

public static readonly System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode DefaultRevocationMode;

DefaultServiceName

The default service name; an empty string.

public const string DefaultServiceName;

DefaultTrustedStoreLocation

The default trusted store location for certificates; StoreLocation.

public static readonly System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreLocation DefaultTrustedStoreLocation;

Properties

AudienceRestriction

Gets or sets the configured AudienceRestriction.

public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.AudienceRestriction AudienceRestriction { get; set; }
Value
AudienceRestriction

The configured AudienceRestriction.

Caches

Gets or sets the configured IdentityModelCaches.

public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityModelCaches Caches { get; set; }
Value
IdentityModelCaches

The configured caches.

Remarks

The IdentityModelCaches contains the token replay cache and session token cache that are configured for this instance.

CertificateValidationMode

Gets or sets the certificate validation mode used by handlers to validate issuer certificates.

public System.ServiceModel.Security.X509CertificateValidationMode CertificateValidationMode { get; set; }
Value
X509CertificateValidationMode

The certificate validation mode.

CertificateValidator

Gets or sets the certificate validator used by handlers to validate issuer certificates.

public System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator CertificateValidator { get; set; }
Value
X509CertificateValidator

The certificate validator.

ClaimsAuthenticationManager

Gets or sets the claims authentication manager. The default is an instance of the ClaimsAuthenticationManager class.

public System.Security.Claims.ClaimsAuthenticationManager ClaimsAuthenticationManager { get; set; }
Value
ClaimsAuthenticationManager

The claims authentication manager.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

An attempt to set the property to null occurs.

ClaimsAuthorizationManager

Gets or sets the claims authorization manager.

public System.Security.Claims.ClaimsAuthorizationManager ClaimsAuthorizationManager { get; set; }
Value
ClaimsAuthorizationManager

The claims authorization manager.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

An attempt to set the property to null occurs.

DetectReplayedTokens

Gets or sets a value in the default handler configuration that indicates whether handlers should detect replayed tokens.

public bool DetectReplayedTokens { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if handlers should detect replayed tokens; otherwise false.

IsInitialized

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the stem.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.Initialize* method has been called.

public virtual bool IsInitialized { get; protected set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the stem.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.Initialize* method has been called; otherwise false.

IssuerNameRegistry

Gets or sets the issuer name registry used to resolve issuer names.

public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.IssuerNameRegistry IssuerNameRegistry { get; set; }
Value
IssuerNameRegistry

The issuer name registry.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

An attempt to set the property to null occurs.

IssuerTokenResolver

Gets or sets the issuer token resolver.

public System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver IssuerTokenResolver { get; set; }
Value
SecurityTokenResolver

The issuer token resolver.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

An attempt to set the property to null occurs.

MaxClockSkew

Gets or sets the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating.

public TimeSpan MaxClockSkew { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

The maximum clock skew.

Name

Gets the service name of this configuration.

public string Name { get; }
Value
String

The service name.

RevocationMode

Gets or sets the revocation mode used by handlers to validate issuer certificates.

public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode RevocationMode { get; set; }
Value
X509RevocationMode

The revocation mode.

SaveBootstrapContext

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the BootstrapContext object is saved in the ClaimsIdentity and Sessions after token validation.

public bool SaveBootstrapContext { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if bootstrap context is saved; otherwise, false.

SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager

Gets the SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager containing the set of SecurityTokenHandler objects that are used to serialize and validate tokens found in WS-Trust messages.

public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager { get; }
Value
SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager

The handler collection manager.

SecurityTokenHandlers

Gets the collection of SecurityTokenHandler objects used to serialize and validate tokens found in WS-Trust messages.

public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerCollection SecurityTokenHandlers { get; }
Value
SecurityTokenHandlerCollection

The collection of token handlers.

Remarks

To register your own token handler, add it to this collection.

ServiceCertificate

Gets or sets the service certificate.

public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 ServiceCertificate { get; set; }
Value
X509Certificate2

The X.509 certificate to use as the service certificate.

Remarks

This is the service certificate that is used to initialize the SecurityTokenResolver specified in the ServiceTokenResolver property and the SessionSecurityTokenHandler.

ServiceTokenResolver

Gets or sets the service token resolver.

public System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver ServiceTokenResolver { get; set; }
Value
SecurityTokenResolver

The service token resolver.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

An attempt to set the property to null occurs.

TokenReplayCacheExpirationPeriod

Gets or sets the expiration period for items placed in the TokenReplayCache.

public TimeSpan TokenReplayCacheExpirationPeriod { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

The expiration period for items placed in the token replay cache.

TrustedStoreLocation

Gets or sets the trusted store location used by handlers to validate issuer certificates.

public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreLocation TrustedStoreLocation { get; set; }
Value
StoreLocation

The trusted store location.

Methods

Initialize()

Updates properties in the SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration objects for the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection objects contained in the stem.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager* to be consistent with the property values on this IdentityConfiguration instance.

public virtual void Initialize ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

This method is invoked more than once.

Remarks

This method should be invoked prior to using the token handlers to process tokens. The SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager property specifies the SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager that contains the security token handlers configured for this instance.

LoadConfiguration(IdentityConfigurationElement)

Loads the settings for this IdentityConfiguration instance from the application or Web configuration file.

protected void LoadConfiguration (System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement element);
element
IdentityConfigurationElement

The IdentityConfigurationElement from the configuration file.

Remarks

If there is no configuration file, if the named section does not exist, or if element is null, then no exception is thrown; instead the instance is loaded with a set of default values. This method calls the LoadHandlers method to load the token handler configuration.

LoadHandlerConfiguration(IdentityConfigurationElement)

Loads a SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration by using the elements directly under the specified IdentityConfigurationElement.

protected System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration LoadHandlerConfiguration (System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement element);
element
IdentityConfigurationElement

The <identityConfiguration> element from the configuration file from which to load settings.

Returns
SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration

The SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration loaded from the elements in the configuration file.

LoadHandlerConfiguration(SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration,SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement)

Loads configuration elements pertaining to the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection.

protected System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration LoadHandlerConfiguration (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration baseConfiguration, System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement element);
baseConfiguration
SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration

The base SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration from which to inherit default values.

element
SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement

The SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement from the configuration file.

Returns
SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration

The SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration loaded from the elements in the configuration file and the baseConfiguration.

LoadHandlers(IdentityConfigurationElement)

Loads the SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager defined for the specified service.

protected System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager LoadHandlers (System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement serviceElement);
serviceElement
IdentityConfigurationElement

The <identityConfiguration> element used to configure this instance.

Returns
SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionManager

The handler collection manager.

Remarks

This method calls the LoadHandlerConfiguration methods to configure the token handlers.
